When the daughter saw the pratyekabuddha's bowl tilting and unable to stay upright, she immediately took off her bracelet and offered it to the pratyekabuddha, saying:
May the great sage please accept this.
Take this bracelet and use it to stabilize the bowl.
At that time, the sage, out of compassion, took the bracelet and used it to stabilize the bowl, and then the bowl did not tip over.

At that time, the woman, seeing that the bowl no longer tipped over and was stabilized by the bracelet, was overjoyed, and her body was filled with delight, unable to contain herself. She made this vow in her mind:
Just as this sage's bowl is stabilized by the bracelet, without tipping or falling over, in my future lives, may what I hear be like this, and may I remember all worldly and transcendent matters.
